meanings.sent1: The bright sun will shine tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: I will go to the park later.
meanings.sent3: The colorful flowers will dance in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as the will to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind will blow the leaves away.

meanings.definition: The mental faculty by which one deliberately chooses or decides upon a course of action.
meanings.sent1: His strong will helped him achieve his goals.
meanings.sent2: She made a decision with a determined will.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn cat showed its will by refusing to move.
meanings.sent4: His will was like a compass guiding him through life.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's will to save lives was unwavering.

meanings.definition: A legal document stating a person's wishes regarding the disposal of their property after death.
meanings.sent1: He left a detailed will for his family.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer read the will to the family members.
meanings.sent3: The ghost in the movie haunted the characters for the will.
meanings.sent4: Her will was a final message to her loved ones.
meanings.sent5: The will was carefully sealed in an envelope.
